greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Distances between successive 2's in sequence A001223 of differences between consecutive primes.
comment: a(n) = number of primes p such that A014574(n) < p < A014574(n+1). - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jul 20 2012

Conjecture: All positive integers are represented in this sequence. This is verified up to 184, by searching up to prime indexes of ~128000000. The rate of filling-in the smallest remaining gap among the integers, and the growth in the maximum value found, both slow down considerably relative to a fixed quantity of twin prime incidences examined in each pass. The maximum value found was 237. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Jul 28 2016
All positive integers below 312 are in this sequence. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 01 2016
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
program: (PARI) n=1; p=5; forprime(q=7,1e3, if(q-p==2, print1(n", "); n=1, n++); p=q) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 01 2016
xref: First differences of A029707 and A155752 = A029707 - 1. _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 24 2012
results.author: Jean-Marc MALASOMA (Malasoma(AT)entpe.fr)
